derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'rejoicing, a celebration'): from Latin gaudium 'joy', or from gaude 'rejoice!', imperative of gaudere

entry.def: If something is gaudy, it is very brightly-coloured and showy.

means.word_mean: 1. a celebratory feast held annually at one of the colleges in a British university
2. (used especially of clothes) marked by conspicuous display
